back.definition: Wired Equivalent Privacy (1997). RC4 encryption con 40-bit key. COMPLETAMENTE broken. Crack-able en minutos con aircrack-ng.
back.example: IV reuse, weak key scheduling. NUNCA usar WEP en 2024. Legacy only. Wi-Fi Alliance deprecated en 2004.

back.definition: WPA2: AES-CCMP encryption. WPA3: SAE (Simultaneous Authentication of Equals), forward secrecy. Protección contra offline dictionary attacks.
back.example: WPA2-Personal (PSK): Shared password. WPA2-Enterprise: RADIUS authentication. WPA3: Mandatory en WiFi 6. Use WPA3 cuando disponible.

back.definition: Unauthorized AP conectado a network. Employee trae router, crea backdoor. Attacker setup fake AP con SSID legítimo (evil twin).
back.example: Coffee shop: Free WiFi - attacker sniffs traffic. Corporate: Employee AP bypasses firewall. Defense: NAC (Network Access Control), wireless IDS.

unlock_content.title: Network Segmentation
points: Guest WiFi: Separate VLAN, no corporate access
IoT WiFi: Isolated VLAN para smart devices
Management: Separate network para AP admin
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Guest breach no debe = corporate breach. VLANs son free isolation.

unlock_content.title: Wireless IDS
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Rogue AP detection debe ser automated. Manual scanning no escala.

content.question: ¿Por qué WPA3 es mejor que WPA2?

options.feedback: Incorrecto. Password length depende de user/policy, no del protocol.

options.text: WPA3 (SAE) protege contra offline dictionary attacks y añade forward secrecy
options.feedback: CORRECTO! WPA2: Attacker captura 4-way handshake, offline dictionary attack. WPA3 (SAE): Each connection different keys, forward secrecy (capture viejo no ayuda). Protection contra KRACK attack. Individual data encryption en open networks.
Incorrecto. Performance es similar. Beneficio es security, no speed.
